newsitem.title: FRANCE: Juppe says France should aim for 3 pct growth.
newsitem.headline: Juppe says France should aim for 3 pct growth.

text.p: French Prime Minister Alain Juppe said on Friday he wanted to escape from the conventional wisdom of lacklustre French economic performance and that three percent annual growth in the coming five years should be an objective.
"France must get back on the path to three percent growth a year over five years," Juppe told France Inter radio. "It's the only way to force unemployment into retreat.
Asked if this amounted to a promise, Juppe replied: "It's a political objective".
Juppe's centre-right coalition government is fighting for re-election in a two round parliamentary poll with the first round on Sunday and the second round a week later on June 1.
